sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"片，块，段"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bit, piece, sheet, slice, fragment, scrap
means: bit ： 侧重指微小，一点点，小碎片。
piece ： 最普通用词，多指从整体上分割下来的东西，可大可小。
sheet ： 侧重指平整很薄的一张或一片。
slice ： 多指切得很薄的一片食物。
fragment ： 指破裂的，不完整的，不可完整的碎片。
scrap ： 侧重指废弃的零碎之物。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"整体的一部分"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: part, piece, section, division, portion, fraction, fragment, segment, share
means: part ： 含义广，最普通用词。常指整体中可大可小的一部分，也可指整体中可分开的独立部分。
piece ： 指整体中的一些个体，尤指从某个整体上分出来的一部分。
section ： 指整体中的分区，部分与部分之间有显著界限。
division ： 通常指按类划分或分割成而的部分。常含抽象意义。
portion ： 侧重从整体中所分配到的那一部分，含一定的独立意义。
fraction ： 指包含在全体中的一部分，暗示微不足道的一部分。
fragment ： 指因破裂、分割等产生的支离破碎、不规则的一部分。
segment ： 指某物的特定部分或自然形成的部分，也指线形物品的一段。
share ： 指共有的东西中应占有的一部分。

list.explanation: 完好无损地(的)，平安地(的)

example.en: She arrived all in one piece.
The plate is in one piece.
Me and my piece of homework want to rent a couple of horses.
example.zh: 我和我的女朋友想租两匹马。

entry.def: A piece of something is an amount of it that has been broken off, torn off, or cut off.
entry.tran: （断下、撕下或切下的）块，片，段，截

example.ex: ...a piece of cake.
example.tran: 一块蛋糕

example.ex: ...a piece of wood.
example.tran: 一截木头

entry.def: A piece of an object is one of the individual parts or sections which it is made of, especially a part that can be removed.

example.ex: ...assembling objects out of standard pieces...
example.tran: 用标准部件组装物品

example.ex: The equipment was taken down the shaft in pieces.
example.tran: 该设备被拆卸成几部分送下了井。

entry.def: A piece of land is an area of land.

example.ex: People struggle to get the best piece of land.
example.tran: 人们竞相争夺最好的土地。

entry.def: You can use piece of with many uncount nouns to refer to an individual thing of a particular kind. For example, you can refer to some advice as a piece of advice.
entry.tran: （与不可数名词连用）桩，项，条，件

example.ex: When I produced this piece of work, my lecturers were very critical...
example.tran: 当我拿出这件作品时，我的讲师们提出了诸多批评意见。

example.ex: It is a highly complex piece of legislation.
example.tran: 它是一项非常复杂的法规。

entry.def: You can refer to an article in a newspaper or magazine, some music written by someone, a broadcast, or a play as a piece .
entry.tran: （报纸或杂志上的一篇）文章；（一首或一部）音乐作品；（一段）广播节目；（一出）戏剧

example.ex: I disagree with Andrew Russell over his piece on British Rail.
example.tran: 我不同意安德鲁·拉塞尔那篇关于英国铁路公司的文章。

example.ex: ...a vaguely familiar orchestral piece...
example.tran: 隐约有点熟悉的一首管弦乐

entry.def: You can refer to a work of art as a piece .

example.ex: Each piece is unique, an exquisite painting of a real person, done on ivory...
example.tran: 每一件艺术品都是绘在象牙上的精美绝伦的真人肖像，都是独一无二的。

example.ex: None of the pieces is insured.
example.tran: 没有一件艺术品上过保险。

entry.def: You can refer to specific coins as pieces. For example, a 10p piece is a coin that is worth 10p.
The pieces which you use when you play a board game such as chess are the specially made objects which you move around on the board.
A piece of something is part of it or a share of it.

example.ex: They got a small piece of the net profits and a screen credit.
example.tran: 他们得到了一小部分纯利润以及电影演职人员字幕中的署名权。

example.ex: ...the disclosure that Texas Air might sell a piece or all of Continental.
example.tran: 得克萨斯航空公司可能会卖掉部分或整个大陆航空公司这一消息的披露

entry.def: If you give someone a piece of your mind, you tell them very clearly that you think they have behaved badly.

example.ex: How very thoughtless. I'll give him a piece of my mind.
example.tran: 真是太没头脑了，我要告诉他我很生气。

entry.def: If something with several different parts is all of a piece, each part is consistent with the others. If one thing is of a piece with another, it is consistent with it.

example.ex: At its peak in the Thirties, Underground design and architecture was all of a piece...
example.tran: 在30年代的顶峰时期，地铁的设计和建筑风格都一模一样。

example.ex: The essays that Parsons completed in the latter part of his life are of a piece with his earlier work.
example.tran: 帕森斯后半生完成的文章和他的早期著作一脉相承。

entry.def: If someone or something is still in one piece after a dangerous journey or experience, they are safe and not damaged or hurt.
entry.tran: 安然无恙的；完好无损的

example.ex: ...providing that my brother gets back alive and in one piece from his mission.
example.tran: 如果我哥哥执行任务能够平安归来

entry.def: If you say your piece, you say everything you want to say about a particular matter without being interrupted, although people may be wanting to express opposing views.
entry.tran: 说自己想说的话；（毫不保留且不受打断地）发表意见

example.ex: I'll answer your questions when I've said my piece.
example.tran: 说完我想说的，我会回答你的问题。

entry.def: You use to pieces in expressions such as 'smash to pieces', and mainly in British English 'fall to pieces' or 'take something to pieces', when you are describing how something is broken or comes apart so that it is in separate pieces.
entry.tran: 成碎片地；散了架地；成组件地

example.ex: If the shell had hit the boat, it would have blown it to pieces...
example.tran: 如果炮弹击中了小船，它早就被炸成碎片了。

example.ex: He took it all to pieces, cleaned it inside and out and put it together again...
example.tran: 他把它全拆了，里外清洁了一下，然后又装了起来。

entry.def: If you go to pieces, you are so upset or nervous that you lose control of yourself and cannot do what you should do.

example.ex: She's a strong woman, but she nearly went to pieces when Arnie died.
example.tran: 她是个坚强的女性，但阿尼去世时，她几乎崩溃了。

entry.def: If someone tears you to pieces ,pulls your work to pieces, or picks your work to pieces, they criticize you or your work very severely.
entry.tran: 把…说得一钱不值；把…批得体无完肤

example.ex: He made numerous errors of fact and was torn to pieces during the subsequent question time...
example.tran: 他犯了数不清的事实错误，并在随后的答疑时间中被批得体无完肤。

example.ex: Every error is captured, every decision picked to pieces.
example.tran: 每个错误都会被抓住，每个决定都会被骂得一无是处。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a nasty piece of work, you mean that they are very unkind or unpleasant.

means.word_mean: 1. a separate part of a whole;

sentences.sentence: "an important piece of the evidence"

means.word_mean: 2. an item that is an instance of some type;

sentences.sentence: "he designed a new piece of equipment"
"she bought a lovely piece of china";

means.word_mean: 3. a portion of a natural object;

sentences.sentence: "they analyzed the river into three parts"
"he needed a piece of granite"

means.word_mean: 4. a musical work that has been created;

sentences.sentence: "the composition is written in four movements"
"it was a nice piece of work"
"he had a bit of good luck"
"he wrote an interesting piece on Iran"
"the children acted out a comic piece to amuse the guests"
"he wore his firearm in a shoulder holster"

means.word_mean: 8. a serving that has been cut from a larger portion;

sentences.sentence: "a piece of pie"
"a slice of bread"
"it is down the road a piece"

means.word_mean: 10. a work of art of some artistic value;

sentences.sentence: "this store sells only objets d'art"
"it is not known who created this piece"

means.word_mean: 11. a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition;

sentences.sentence: "he was here for a little while"
"I need to rest for a piece"
"a spell of good weather"
"a patch of bad weather"
"a slice of the company's revenue"

means.word_mean: 13. game equipment consisting of an object used in playing certain board games;

sentences.sentence: "he taught me to set up the men on the chess board"
"he sacrificed a piece to get a strategic advantage"

means.word_mean: 1. to join or unite the pieces of;

sentences.sentence: "patch the skirt"
"She pieced a quilt"
"He tacked together some verses"
"piece the broken pieces of thread, slivers, and rovings"

means.word_mean: 4. eat intermittently; take small bites of;

sentences.sentence: "He pieced at the sandwich all morning"
"She never eats a full meal--she just nibbles"
"She pieced the china cup"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French piece (compare with medieval Latin pecia, petium), of obscure ultimate origin
